album.albumName: You Don't Mess Around with Jim

descr.p: "Time in a Bottle" was a posthumous number-one hit for singer-songwriter Jim Croce, reaching the top of the charts in December 1973, three months after his death in a plane crash.

The song was originally written for Croce's son, A.J., and appeared on his first album in 1972, You Don't Mess Around with Jim. The following year Croce would shoot to fame with his hit single "Bad Bad Leroy Brown", just months before the September 20 plane crash. Time in a Bottlewas later used as the title for a compilation album of Croce's love songs.
The song started receiving widespread airplay in the fall of 1973, after it was featured in an ABC TV movie, She Lives!, starring Desi Arnaz Jr. and Season Hubley.
